measured_by: Belief in a Just World Scale
justification: “Beliefs in a Just World. Six items measured a belief in a just world (Dalbert, 1999).”
“Political ideology. Three items measured political ideology: ‘Where on the following scale of political orientation would you place yourself?’ … (α = .95).”
“Six items from the Attributions of Poverty Questionnaire (Bullock et al., 2003) measured structural attributions of poverty.”

“We used five items to measure system-level blame. A representative item is, ‘To what extent do you think the nature of the game is to blame for the unfair distribution of money in the game?’ (α = .65).”

topic_or_construct: Structural attributions for unfairness in the game
measured_by: Three-item structural attributions for unfairness scale
justification: “We created three items to assess structural attributions for unfairness in the game (adapted from the structural attributions for poverty scale; Bullock et al., 2003).”
